active_contexts.statement: Eurozone Dec final mfg PMI 48.8 (vs 49.2 prelim), deeper contraction; Germany final 47.0.
active_contexts.market_link: Weaker EU growth impulse can lean risk sentiment and support quality duration; EUR-sensitive risk can react via 6E/DX.
active_contexts.notes: Final prints were weaker vs prelim; headline risk mainly via Europe growth tone.

active_contexts.statement: ECB: Eurozone M3 y/y 3.0% in Nov (Oct 2.8%); M1 y/y 5.0% (Oct 5.2%).
active_contexts.market_link: Incremental euro-area liquidity improvement can affect EUR rates/risk correlations; usually a second-order driver vs PMIs.
active_contexts.notes: Monthly monetary data is slower-moving; watch for confirmation in credit/lending trends.

active_contexts.statement: US S&P Global final mfg PMI confirmed 51.8 for Dec; expansion but slower than Nov (52.2).
active_contexts.market_link: Steady/softening growth signals mainly transmit to front-end rates and equity cyclicality; limited surprise vs consensus.
active_contexts.notes: Headline matches forecast; subcomponents (orders/exports/prices) matter more than the print.

active_contexts.statement: Fed NY SRF usage hit record $74.6B on Dec 31 amid year-end funding needs; RRP usage also rose.
active_contexts.market_link: Funding-market tightness can spill into bill/GC repo and front-end rates (ZT) and broader risk tone (ES/NQ).
active_contexts.notes: Primarily a turn-of-year technical; monitor if elevated usage persists post turn.

active_contexts.statement: UK Dec final mfg PMI 50.6 (flash 51.2), still >50 for 2nd month; less momentum than initial read.
active_contexts.market_link: UK data can influence European risk tone and EUR/GBP complex; typically modest direct impact on US index futures.
active_contexts.notes: Included for cross-Atlantic macro tone; not usually a primary US driver.

watchlist.statement: US cash close: large MOC buy imbalance reported (S&P/NQ/Dow/Mag7 all positive).
watchlist.market_link: End-of-day index-fund flows can create late-session futures dislocations and next-session gap risk in ES/NQ.
watchlist.notes: Flow data is time-decaying; relevance typically limited to same/next session.

upcoming_catalysts.name: Final Manufacturing PMI
upcoming_catalysts.why_it_matters: Usually low impact vs ISM; revisions to prices/orders can still nudge rates/risk if meaningful.

upcoming_catalysts.name: FOMC Member Paulson Speaks
upcoming_catalysts.why_it_matters: Any guidance on reaction function/cuts path can move front-end and drive equity duration sensitivity.

upcoming_catalysts.name: FOMC Member Paulson Speaks
upcoming_catalysts.why_it_matters: Second appearance can reinforce/clarify messaging; watch for consistency with recent minutes and market pricing.

change_log.reason: High-impact Europe macro: Eurozone final PMI weaker than prelim; Germany final notably lower.
ECB monetary data released Jan 2 shows M3 growth uptick; useful liquidity backdrop for EUR/risk correlations.
US final PMI confirmed at consensus; include as low-surprise growth confirmation.
Reuters reported record SRF usage into year-end; relevant for front-end/funding tone.
UK final PMI materially below flash; cross-market growth tone item.
Large MOC buy imbalance is a near-term flow driver for US index futures.
